रिकार्ड.
After his success on Jeopardy !, Jennings wrote about his experience and explored American trivia history and culture in his book Brainiac : Adventures in the Curious, Competitive, बाध्यता संसार of ट्रिविया Buffs, published in 2006.
The Canadian Football League or CFL ( ' [ LCF ] in फ्रेंच ) is a पेशेवर sports league located in Canada.
The CFL is the highest level of प्रतियोगिता in कनाडाई फ़ुटबॉल, a form of gridiron football closely related to American football.
Its eight वर्तमान टीमों, जिससे हैं स्तिथ in आठ पृथक शहरों, हैं divided into two divisions of four teams each — the East Division and the West Division.
The league 's 19-week regular season runs इससे late June to early November ; each team plays 18 games with one bye week.
following the नियमित ऋतु, the तीन टीमों साथ the बेहतरीन रिकॉर्ड in उनके प्रभाग ( मगर if the चौथी प्लेस टोली in एक प्रभाग रै a बेहतर रिकार्ड than the तीसरा प्लेस टोली in the other division, when the team with the better record makes the playoffs and `` crosses over '' to the other division 's playoff ) compete in the league 's three-week divisional playoffs, which culminate in the late-November Grey Cup championship, the country 's largest annual sports and television event.
The CFL was officially founded on January 19, 1958, making it the second oldest gridiron football league in North America still in operation, हालांकि सब इसके टीमों long predate the modern formation of the league.
It is the highest level of play in Canadian football, the most popular football league in Canada, and the second-most popular major sports लीग in कनाडा, बाद the नेशनल हॉकी League.
Although ice hockey is Canada 's most popular sport, the CFL has increased the लोकप्रियता of कनाडाई football in Quebec and Western Canada.
Canadian football is also played at amateur levels ( i.e. youth, high स्कूल, cjfl, qjfl, cis और senior leagues such as the Alberta Football League ).
The 2010s will be a significant decade for the CFL in terms of growth, as teams have renovated, expanded स्टेडियम, or plan to build entirely new stadiums.
The Montreal Alouettes accomplished this first, adding 5,000 seats to Percival Molson मेमोरियल Stadium in time for the 2010 CFL season.
The एडमॉन्टन एस्किमोस और कैला स्तेमपेड्रस also renovated their respective stadiums and facilities for the 2010 season.
In 2011, the BC Lions played under a new, retractable roof in BC Place after spending एक और a हाफ सीज़न at साम्राज्य फ़ील्ड.
Then the Winnipeg Blue Bombers will play in an entirely new stadium at the University of मनिटोबा, अनुसूचित to खोलें in समय for the 2013 season.
The Hamilton Tiger-Cats, Saskatchewan Roughriders and the new Ottawa franchise are also looking at नई or extensively-renovated stadiums in the following years.
There are also hopes of expanding the league to Atlantic Canada ( ideally basing a team in either the अधिक आबादी halifax, or the more centralized Moncton ), as 2010 and 2011 had regular season games hosted in Moncton.
According to sports historian Douglas Brei, the Canadian Football League holds the distinction of being the only professional sports league in North America, major or minor league, in जिससे प्रत्येक मौजूदा मताधिकार रै जीती at तनिक एक लीग शीर्षक while in their current location.
Each antibody binds to a विशिष्ट प्रतिजन ; an बातचीत similar to a lock and key.
An antibody ( Ab ), also known as an immunoglobulin ( ig ), is a large Y-shaped protein produced by B-cells that is used by the immune system to identify and neutralize foreign objects such as bacteria and viruses.
The antibody recognizes a unique part of the foreign target, पुकारा an प्रतिजन.
Each tip of the `` Y '' of an antibody contains a paratope ( a structure analogous to a lock ) that is specific for one particular epitope ( similarly analogous to a key ) on an antigen, allowing these two structures to bind together with precision.
Using this binding mechanism, an antibody can tag a microbe or an संक्रमित कोशिका लिये आक्रमण by अन्य भाग of the प्रतिरक्षा प्रणाली, or can neutralize its target directly ( for example, by blocking a part of a microbe that is essential for its invasion and survival ).
The production of antibodies is the main फलन of the humoral immune system.
Antibodies are secreted by a type of white blood cell called a प्लाज्मा कोशिका.
Antibodies can occur in two physical forms, a soluble form कि is स्रावित इससे the कोशिका, और a झिल्ली -bound रूप that is attached to the surface of a B cell and is referred to as the B cell receptor ( BCR ).
The BCR is only found on the सतह of b कोशिकाएं और facilitates the सक्रियण of ये कोशिकाएं और उनके subsequent differentiation into either antibody factories called plasma cells, or memory B cells that will survive in the body and remember that same antigen so the B cells can respond faster upon future exposure.
In most cases, interaction of the B कोशिका साथ a t हेल्पर कोशिका is जरुरी to उपज पूरा सक्रियण of the B cell and, therefore, antibody generation following antigen binding.
Soluble antibodies हैं released into the blood and tissue fluids, as well as many secretions to continue to survey for invading microorganisms.
antibodies हैं glycoproteins belonging to the immunoglobulin superfamily ; the terms antibody and immunoglobulin are often used interchangeably.
Antibodies are typically made of basic structural units—each साथ दो विशाल भारी जंजीरों और दो छोटी light chains.
There are several different types of antibody भारी जंजीरों, और अनेक अलग kinds of antibodies, which are grouped into different isotypes based on which heavy chain they possess.
Five different antibody isotypes are known in mammals, which perform different roles, and help direct the appropriate immune response for each अलग प्रकार of foreign object they encounter.
Though the general structure of all antibodies is very similar, a small region at the tip of the protein is अत्यधिक परिवर्तनीय, allowing लाखो of antibodies with slightly different tip structures, or antigen binding sites, to exist.
This प्रदेश is ज्ञात as the hypervariable region.
Each of ये विसंगतियाँ can bind to a different antigen.
This enormous diversity of antibodies allows the immune system to recognize an बराबर चौड़ी किस्में of antigens.
The large and diverse population of antibodies is generated by random combinations of a नियत of जीन खण्ड कि encode अलग प्रतिजन बाइंडिंग साइट ( or paratopes ), followed by random mutations in this area of the antibody gene, which create further diversity.
Antibody genes also re-organize in a process called class switching that changes the base of the भारी कड़ी to another, बनाना a अलग isotype of the antibody that retains the antigen specific variable region.
इस allows a सिंगल antibody to be used by several different parts of the immune system.
The symbol used by the Zodiac Killer to चिह्न उसके पत्राचार
The Zodiac Killer was a serial killer who संचालित in उत्तरी California in the late 1960s and early 1970s.
The killer 's identity remains unknown.
The zodiac murdered पीड़ितों in benicia, Vallejo, Lake Berryessa, and San Francisco between December 1968 and October 1969.
चार मेन और तीन महिलाओं between the ages of 16 and 29 were targeted.
The killer originated the name `` Zodiac '' in a series of taunting अक्षर भेजा to the local Bay Area press.
These letters included four cryptograms ( or ciphers ).
Of the four cryptograms sent, only one रै महरूम definitively solved.
Suspects have महरूम नामित by विधि प्रवर्तन and amateur investigators, but no conclusive evidence has surfaced.
In April 2004, the San Francisco Police Department marked the case `` inactive '', yet re-opened the case at some point prior to March 2007.
the मामला भी remains खोलें in the city of Vallejo, as well as in Napa County and Solano County.
The California Department of Justice has maintained an खोलें मामला संचिका on the zodiac murders since 1969.
Jennings is a small city in and the parish seat of Jefferson डेविस मोहल्ला, louisiana, United States, near Lake Charles.
The population was 10,383 at the 2010 census, a छोटी मनाही इससे the 2000 tabulation.
The city is 68 percent श्वेत.
Jennings is the principal city of the Jennings micropolitan सांख्यिकीय क्षेत्रफल, जिससे includes all of Jefferson Davis Parish.
It is also part of the larger Lake Charles-Jennings संयुक्त Statistical Area.
Nanotechnology ( sometimes shortened to `` nanotech '' ) is the हेरफेर of पदार्थ on an परमाणु and molecular scale.
The earliest, फैली वर्णन of nanotechnology referred to the particular technological goal of precisely manipulating atoms and molecules for fabrication of macroscale products, also now referred to as molecular nanotechnology.
A more generalized description of nanotechnology was subsequently established by the National Nanotechnology Initiative, which defines nanotechnology as the manipulation of matter with at तनिक एक आयाम sized इससे 1 to 100 nanometers.
This definition reflects the fact that quantum mechanical प्रभाव हैं महत्वपूर्ण at इस quantum-realm स्केल, और so the परिभाषा shifted इससे a particular technological goal to a research category inclusive of all types of research and technologies that deal with the special properties of matter that occur below the given size threshold.
It is therefore common to see the plural form `` nanotechnologies '' as खूब as `` nanoscale technologies '' to refer to the broad range of research and applications whose common trait is size.
Because of the variety of potential applications ( including industrial and military ), governments have invested अरबों of डॉलर in nanotechnology research.
Through its National Nanotechnology Initiative, the यूएसए रै invested 3.7 billion dollars.
The European Union has invested 1.2 billion and Japan 750 लाख dollars.
Nanotechnology as defined by size is naturally very broad, including फ़ील्ड of विज्ञान as विविध as सतह विज्ञान, सशुल्क रसायन, molecular biology, semiconductor physics, microfabrication, etc.
The associated research and applications are equally diverse, ranging from extensions of conventional device physics to completely new approaches based upon molecular self-assembly, from विकासशील नई सामग्री साथ आयाम on the nanoscale to direct control of matter on the atomic scale.
Scientists फिलहाल बहस the future implications of nanotechnology.
Nanotechnology may be able to create many new materials and devices साथ a विशाल दायरा of applications, such as in medicine, electronics, biomaterials and energy production.
On the अन्य हाथ, nanotechnology उठाता अनेक of the वही मुद्दे as कोई नई technology, including concerns about the toxicity and environmental impact of nanomaterials, and their potential effects on global economics, as well as speculation about various doomsday scenarios.
These concerns have led to a debate among advocacy groups and सरकारें on whether special regulation of nanotechnology is warranted.
Map of the पूर्वी Bloc
The term Eastern Bloc or Communist Bloc refers to the former communist states of Central and Eastern Europe, generally the सोवियत संघ और the देशों of the वॉरसॉ Pact.
The terms Communist Bloc and Soviet Bloc यहूद भी प्रयुक्त to denote groupings of states aligned with the Soviet Union, although these terms might include states outside Central and Eastern Europe.
The New Jersey gubernatorial चुनाव of 2009 took प्लेस on November 3, 2009.
लोकतांत्रिक राज्यपाल jon corzine थी कार्यशील लिये a दूसरी term and was being challenged by Republican Chris Christie, Independent Christopher Daggett and nine others, in addition to several write-in candidates.
Christie won the election, with about 48.5 percent of the vote, to 44.9 percent for Corzine and 5.8 प्रतिशत लिये daggett.
Christie won the largest margin for a first पद रिपब्लिकन चूंकि 1969.
क्रिस्टी assumed दफ्तर on January 19, 2010.
This was the first election to fill the newly निर्मित दफ्तर of Lieutenant Governor.
The candidates for governor and lieutenant governor यहूद joined साथ as a single choice, so that voters did not have the opportunity to split the ticket.
Kim Guadagno, Christie 's running mate, became New Jersey 's first lieutenant governor following उसके उद्घाटन.
Health care in the United States is provided by अनेक पृथक organizations.
Health care facilities are largely owned and operated by निजी सेक्टर व्यवसायों.
Health insurance लिये पब्लिक sector employees is primarily provided by the government.
60-65 % of healthcare provision and spending comes from programs such as Medicare, Medicaid, TRICARE, the children 's स्वास्थ्य बीमे कार्यक्रम, और the दिग्गजों स्वास्थ्य Administration.
Most of the population under 65 is insured by their or a family member 's employer, some buy स्वास्थ्य बीमे on उनके own, and the remainder are uninsured.
Of 17 high-income countries studied by the National Institutes of Health in 2013, the संयुक्त राज्य थी at or निकट the नीचे in शिशु मृत्यु, heart and lung disease, sexually transmitted infections, adolescent pregnancies, injuries, homicides, and rates of disability.
Together, such issues place the U.S. at the bottom of the सूची लिये जीवन expectancy.
On average, a U.S. male can be expected to live almost four कम सालो than those in the top-ranked country.
According to the संसार स्वास्थ्य संगठन ( जो ), the संयुक्त राज्य खर्च अधिक on स्वास्थ्य परवाह per capita ( $ 7,146 ), and more on health care as percentage of its GDP ( 15.2 % ), than any other nation in 2008.
The Commonwealth Fund ranked the United States last in the quality of health care among समान देशों, और notes U.S. care costs the most.
The U.S. Census Bureau reported that 49.9 लाख निवासियों, 16.3 % of the जनसांख्यिकी, यहूद uninsured in 2010 ( up from 49.0 million residents, 16.1 % of the population, in 2009 ).
A 2004 Institute of Medicine ( IOM ) report said : `` The United States is among the few industrialized राष्ट्र in the संसार कि करता नहीं गारंटी access to health care for its population. ''
A 2004 OECD report said : `` With the exception of Mexico, Turkey, and the United States, all OECD countries had achieved universal or near-universal ( at least 98.4 % insured ) कवरेज of उनके populations by 1990. ''
A 2010 report observed that lack of health insurance causes roughly 48,000 अनावश्यक मौतों प्रत्येक साल in the संयुक्त States.
In 2007, 62.1 % of filers लिये bankruptcies claimed high medical expenses.
A 2013 study found that about 25 % of all senior citizens declare bankruptcy due to medical expenses, and 43 % हैं मजबूर to बंधक or sell their primary residence.
On कूच 23, 2010, the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act ( PPACA ) became law, providing for major changes in health insurance.
In physiology, body जल is the water content of the human body.
A significant भिन्न of the human body is water.
Arthur Guyton 's Textbook of Medical Physiology states that `` the कुल राशि of जल in a man of औसत weight ( 70 kilograms ) is approximately 40 litres, averaging 57 percent of his total body weight.
In a newborn infant, this may be as high as 75 प्रतिशत of the देह वज़न, लकिन it progressively decreases इससे जनम to old age, most of the decrease occurring during the first 10 years of life.
Also, obesity decreases the percentage of water in the देह, sometimes to as कम as 45 percent ''.
These figures are सांख्यिकीय averages, so हैं illustrative, और जैसे सब biostatistics, will vary with things like type of population, age and number of people sampled, and methodology.
So there is not, and can not be, a figure that is exactly the same for all people, for this or कोई अन्य physiological measure.
For example, Jackson 's ( 1985 ) anatomy & physiology लिये नर्स gives a figure of 60 % for the proportion of body-weight attributable to water, which approximates Guyton 's 57 %.
In diseased states where body water is affected, the compartment or compartments कि have बदला can दे clues to the प्रकृति of the प्रॉब्लम.
Body water is regulated by hormones, including anti-diuretic hormone ( ADH ), aldosterone and अलिंदी natriuretic पेप्टाइड.
Per Netter 's Atlas of Human physiology, देह जल is टूटा bas into the following compartments:
intracellular द्रव ( 2/3 of body water ).
Per Guyton, in a body containing 40 लीटर of द्रव, परिचय 25 लीटर is intracellular, which amounts to 62.5 % ( 5/8 ), close enough to the 2/3 rule of thumb.
जैक्सन 's texts states 70 % of body fluid is intracellular.
extracellular द्रव ( 1/3 of body water ).
Per Guyton 's illustration, for a 40 litre body, about 15 लीटर is extracellular, जिससे amounts to 37.5 % Again, this is close to the 1/3 rule of thumb cited here.
Plasma ( 1/5 of extracellular fluid ).
Per Guyton 's उदाहरण, of the 15 लीटर of extracellular fluid, plasma volume averages 3 litres.
This amounts to 20 %, the same as per netter 's एटलस.
Interstitial fluid ( 4/5 of extracellular fluid )
transcellular द्रव ( a.k.a. `` third space, '' normally ignored in calculations )
Contained inside organs, such as the gastrointestinal, प्रमस्तिष्कमेरु, उदरावरणीय, और ocular fluids.
Self-esteem is a term used in psychology to reflect a person 's overall emotional मूल्यांकन of उसके or her own worth.
It is a judgement of oneself as well as an रवैया toward the self.
Self-esteem encompasses beliefs ( लिये उदाहरण, `` i am competent, '' `` I am worthy '' ) and emotions such as triumph, despair, pride and shame.
Smith and mackie define it by saying `` The self-concept is what we think about the self ; self-esteem, is the positive or negative evaluations of the self, as in how we feel about it. ''
Self-esteem is also known as the evaluative आयाम of the self that includes feelings of worthiness, prides and discouragement.
One 's self-esteem is भी closely associated with self-consciousness.
Self-esteem is a disposition that a व्यक्ति रै जिससे represents their judgements of their own worthiness.
In the mid-1960s, Morris Rosenberg and social-learning पैरोकार पारिभाषित self-esteem as a personal worth or worthiness.
Nathaniel branden in 1969 पारिभाषित self-esteem as `` the अनुभव of being competent to cope with the basic challenges of life and being worthy of happiness. ''
according to branden, self-esteem is the sum of self-confidence ( a feeling of personal capacity ) and self-respect ( a feeling of personal worth ).
It exists as a consequence of the implicit judgement that every person has of their क्षमता to फेस जीवन 's चुनौतियां, to समझे और solve समस्याएं, और their right to achieve happiness, and be given respect.
As a social psychological construct, self-esteem is attractive because researchers have conceptualized it as an influential predictor of प्रासंगिक outcomes, ऐसे as अकादमिक उपलब्धि ( Marsh 1990 ) or exercise behavior ( Hagger et al. 1998 ).
In addition, self-esteem has also been treated as an important outcome due to its close संबंध साथ मनोवैज्ञानिक well-being ( दलदल 1989 ).
Self-esteem can apply specifically to a particular dimension ( for example, `` I believe I am a good writer and I feel happy about that '' ) or a global extent ( लिये उदाहरण, `` i मानना i am a ख़राब person, and feel bad about myself in general '' ).
Psychologists usually लिहाज़ self-esteem as an enduring व्यक्तित्व characteristic ( `` trait '' self-esteem ), though normal, short-term variations ( `` state '' self-esteem ) also exist.
Synonyms or near-synonyms of self-esteem शामिल : self-worth, self-regard, self-respect, and self-integrity.
A Masonic Lodge, often termed a Private Lodge or Constituent Lodge, is the मौलिक organisational ईकाई of freemasonry.
Every new Lodge must be warranted or chartered by a Grand Lodge, but is subject to its direction only in enforcing the प्रकाशित Constitution of the jurisdiction.
By exception the three surviving lodges that formed the world 's first known Grand Lodge in London ( today called the United Grand Lodge of England ) have the unique privilege to operate as time immemorial i.e. बगैर ऐसे वारंट ; तभी एक अन्य आवास operates बगैर a वारंट - this is the Grand Stewards ' Lodge in London, although it is not also entitled to the `` time immemorial '' title.
A Freemason is generally हकदार to विज़िट कोई आवास, in कोई क्षेत्राधिकार ( i.e. under any Grand Lodge ) in amity with his own.
In some jurisdictions इस privilege is restricted to Master Masons ( that is, Freemasons who have attained the Order 's third degree ).
He is first usually required to check, and certify, the regularity of the relationship of the आवास - और be समर्थ to satisfy कि आवास of उसके नियमितता of सदस्यता.
Freemasons gather together as a आवास to कार्य the तीन मौलिक डिग्री of डाला Apprentice, Fellowcraft and Master Mason.
Pilkington Group Limited is a multinational glass manufacturing company headquartered in St Helens, United Kingdom and a wholly स्वामित्व subsidiary of the japan-based NSG Group.
Prior to its acquisition by NSG in 2006 it थी an स्वतंत्र कम्पनी सूचीबद्ध on the London Stock Exchange and for a time was a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index.
A quotation is the repetition of one अभिव्यक्ति as भाग of another एक, विशेषकर when the quoted expression is well-known or explicitly attributed by citation to its original source, and it is indicated by ( punctuated with ) quotation marks.
A quotation can भी refer to the दोहराया उपयोग of इकाई of कोई अन्य रूप of expression, especially parts of artistic works : elements of a painting, scenes from a movie or sections from a musical composition.
Year 1877 ( MDCCCLXXVII ) was a आम साल starting on सोमवार ( कड़ी होगा प्रदर्शक the पूरा calendar ) of the Gregorian calendar and a common year starting on Saturday of the 12-day slower Julian calendar.
ब्लैक pepper ( पाइपर nigrum ) is a flowering vine in the family Piperaceae, cultivated for its fruit, which is usually dried and used as a spice and seasoning.
The fruit, known as a peppercorn when dried, is approximately in diameter, dark red जब fully वयस्क, and, like all drupes, contains a single seed.
Peppercorns, and the ground pepper derived from them, may be described simply as pepper, or more precisely as black pepper ( cooked and dried unripe fruit ), green pepper ( dried unripe fruit ) and श्वेत pepper ( dried ripe seeds ).
Black pepper is native to south India, and is extensively cultivated वहीँ और elsewhere in तीव्र regions.
फिलहाल वियतनाम is the संसार 's largest निर्माता और exporter of pepper, producing 34 % of the world 's Piper nigrum crop as of 2008.
Dried ground pepper has been used since antiquity for दोनो इसके फ्लेवर और as a medicine.
Black pepper is the world 's most traded spice.
It is एक of the सबसे आम मसाले added to European cuisine and its descendants.
The spiciness of black pepper is due to the chemical piperine, नहीं to be उलझन with the capsaicin that gives fleshy peppers theirs.
It is in the modern world, प्रायः युग्म with salt.
Fire hydrant in charlottesville, Virginia, USA
A fire hydrant ( also known colloquially as a fire plug in the United States or as a johnny pump in New York City ), is an active fire protection measure, and a source of जल provided in सबसे शहरी, suburban और ग्रामीण क्षेत्रों साथ नगरपालिका जल सेवा to enable अग्निशमन to tap into the municipal water supply to assist in extinguishing a fire.
Buildings near a hydrant may qualify for an insurance discount since firefighters should be able to more rapidly बुझा a आग on the insured प्रॉपर्टी.
The concept of fire plugs तिथियाँ to at तनिक the 17th century.
This was a time when अग्निशमन responding to a कॉल होता खुदाई bas to the wooden water mains and hastily bore a hole to secure water to fight fires.
The water would fill the hole creating a temporary well, and be transported from the well to the आग by बाल्टी brigades or, बाद, by hand-pumped fire engines.
The holes यहूद तब plugged साथ stoppers, सामान्यतः redwood, which over time came to be known as fire plugs.
The location of the plug would often be recorded or marked so that it could be reused in future fires.
This is the source of the colloquial term fire plug still used लिये आग hydrants today.
After the Great Fire of London in 1666, the city संस्थापित जल मेन्स साथ छेद drilled at intervals, equipped साथ risers, allowing an access point to the wooden fire plugs from street level.
The invention of a post- or pillar-type fire hydrant is generally credited to Frederick Graff Sr., मुख्य इंजीनियर of the फिलाडेल्फिया जल works around the year 1801.
It had a combination hose/faucet आउटलेट और थी of `` गीला barrel '' design with the valve in the top.
It is said that Graff held the first patent लिये a आग hydrant, लकिन इस can नहीं be सत्यापित क्युकी the patent office in Washington D.C. caught on fire in 1836 destroying many patent records from that period in the process.
The President of the Republic of South Africa is the head of राज्य and head of government under South Africa 's Constitution.
From 1961 to 1994, the head of state was पुकारा the राज्य अध्यक्ष.
The President is elected by members of the National Assembly, the lower house of Parliament, and is usually the leader of the largest party, which has been the African नेशनल कॉंग्रेस चूंकि the पहला non-racial चुनावों were held on 27 April 1994.
The role was originally founded to be distinct from the now defunct role of prime minister, but the दो भूमिकाएँ यहूद मिलाया in the 1983 constitution which specified a four-year term of office.
the 1993 और बाद constitutions limits the president 's time in office to two five-year terms.
The first President to be elected under the नई संविधान थी Nelson Mandela, and the incumbent president is Jacob Zuma.
Under the interim Constitution ( valid from 1994 to 1996 ), there was a Government of National Unity, in which an MP from the largest opposition party was entitled to a position as Deputy President.
Along with Thabo mbeki, the पिछला राज्य अध्यक्ष, f.w. de klerk भी परोसा as डिप्टी अध्यक्ष, in his capacity as the leader of the National Party which was the second-largest party in the new Parliament.
But De Klerk later resigned और गई into opposition with his party.
A voluntary coalition government continues to exist under the new संविधान ( अपनाया in 1996 ), although there have been no appointments of opposition politicians to the post of deputy president.
Special education or special needs शिक्षा is the शिक्षा of students with special needs in a way that addresses the students ' individual differences and needs.
Ideally, this process involves the individually planned and systematically monitored व्यवस्था of शिक्षण प्रक्रियाओं, adapted उपकरण and materials, accessible settings, and other interventions designed to help learners with special needs achieve a higher level of personal self-sufficiency and success in school and community than would be available if the student were only given access to a typical classroom education.
Common special needs include challenges with सीखना, communication challenges, emotional and behavioral disorders, physical disabilities, and developmental disorders.
Students with these kinds of special needs are likely to benefit इससे अतिरिक्त शैक्षणिक सेवाएं such as different approaches to teaching, use of technology, a specifically adapted teaching area, or resource room.
Intellectual giftedness is a difference in learning and can also benefit from specialized teaching techniques or different educational programs, but the term `` special education '' is generally used to specifically indicate निर्देश of विद्यार्थी whose special needs reduce their ability to learn independently or in an ordinary classroom, and gifted education is handled separately.
In most developed countries, educators are modifying teaching methods and environments so that the maximum number of विद्यार्थी हैं परोसा in सामान्य शिक्षा environments.
Special education in developed countries is often regarded less as a `` प्लेस '' और अधिक as `` a range of services, available in every school. ''
Integration can reduce social stigmas and improve अकादमिक उपलब्धि लिये अनेक विद्यार्थी.
The opposite of special education is सामान्य शिक्षा.
General education is the standard curriculum presented with standard teaching विधि और बगैर additional supports.
George Soros ( or ; ; ; born August 12, 1930, as Schwartz György ) is a Hungarian-American business magnate, investor, and लोकसेवक.
He is the chairman of Soros Fund प्रबन्धन.
Soros supports progressive-liberal कल्याणकारी.
He is known as `` The Man Who Broke the Bank of England `` because of his in investment profits दौरान the 1992 ब्लैक बुधवार uk करेंसी crisis.
Between 1979 and 2011, Soros gave दूर over $ 8 billion to human rights, public health, and education causes.
He played a significant role in the peaceful transition from communism to capitalism in Hungary ( 1984–89 ) and provided one of Europe 's largest higher शिक्षा endowments to सेंट्रल यूरोपीय विश्वविद्यालयों in बुडापेस्ट.
Soros is also the chairman of the Open समाज संस्थान.
An actor portraying सिकंदर ग्राहम घंटी बोलना into an early model telephone.
The invention of the telephone is the culmination of work done by अनेक individuals, the इतिहास of जिससे involves a संग्रहण of दावा and counterclaims.
The development of the modern electrical telephone involved an array of lawsuits founded upon the patent claims of अनेक individuals और numerous कंपनियाँ.
This article covers the early years from 1844 to 1898, इससे धारणा of the विचार of an इलेक्ट्रिक voice-transmission यंत्र, to विफल attempts to use `` make-and-break '' current, to successful experiments with electromagnetic telephones by Alexander Graham Bell and Thomas Watson, and finally to commercially successful telephones in the late 19th century.
A Master of Fine कला ( mfa, m.f.a. ) is a ग्रैजुएट उपाधि typically requiring 2–3 सालो of postgraduate पढ़ाई beyond the bachelor 's degree ( BFA ), although the term of study will vary by country or by university.
The MFA is a रचनात्मक उपाधि प्रायः awarded as a terminal degree in visual arts, creative writing, filmmaking, dance, or theatre and other performing arts.
coursework is primarily of an applied or performing nature with the program often culminating in a major work or performance.
Master of Fine Arts programs have generally required a bachelor 's उपाधि prior to प्रवेश, but many do not require that the undergraduate major be the same as the MFA field of study.
The most important admissions requirement has often been a sample portfolio or a performance audition.
The Master of Fine Arts differs from the Master of Arts in that the MFA, while an academic program, centers around अभ्यास in the particular फ़ील्ड, whereas programs leading to the MA usually center on the scholarly, academic, or critical study of the field.
Additionally, in the United States, an MFA is recognized as a टर्मिनल उपाधि लिये practitioners of विज़ुअल आर्ट, डिज़ाइन, नृत्य, थिएटर, film/video, नई मीडिया, और Creative Writing - meaning that it is considered to be the highest degree in its field, and is used as a minimum qualification to be able to apply to become a Full-Time Professor teaching at the University level in these disciplines.
There are exceptions to this standard in the Arts, notably in the case of music performance, जहाँ the mfa is नहीं देखी as a टर्मिनल degree in the context of the more standardized DMA degree.
It is also critical to note that in the interest of extending the connection between रचनात्मक उत्पादन और जारी अकादमिक शोध, कुछ विश्वविद्यालयों have स्थापित practice-based ph.d programs in fields such as creative writing, visual arts, new media, design and theater.
While this has had an effect in Creative Writing, and to a lesser extent in design and new media, the influx of graduates इससे practice-based phd कार्यक्रम has not appreciably changed the standard for the MFA as the terminal degree in most Arts disciplines yet.
This is an ongoing contentious topic, and is the बारंबार विषय of अकादमिक panels, especially at the annual College Art Association conference.
The CAA 2008 guidelines regarding the MFA strongly re-affirms that the PhD is not required as a टर्मिनल उपाधि in the विज़ुअल कला.
The atomic bombings of the cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki in Japan were conducted by the United States during the final stages of World War II in 1945.
The two कार्यक्रम हैं the only use of nuclear weapons in war to date.
Following a firebombing अभियान कि नष्ट many Japanese cities, the Allies prepared for a costly invasion of Japan.
The war in Europe ended when Nazi जर्मनी हस्ताक्षरित इसके यंत्र of surrender on 8 May, but the Pacific War continued.
Together with the United Kingdom and the Republic of China, the United States called for a आत्मसमर्पण of जापानी in the पॉट्सडैम घोषणा on 26 जुलाई 1945, threatening जापानी with `` prompt and utter destruction ''.
The Japanese government ignored this ultimatum, and the United States तैनात दो नाभिकीय हथियार developed by the Manhattan Project.
अमरीकी airmen dropped Little Boy on the city of Hiroshima on 6 August 1945, followed by Fat Man over Nagasaki on 9 August.
Within the first two to four months of the bombings, the acute effects मारे 90,000–166,000 लोगों in हिरोशिमा और 60,000–80,000 in नागासाकी, with roughly half of the deaths in each city occurring on the first day.
The हिरोशिमा प्रीफ़ेक्चर स्वास्थ्य department estimated that, of the people who died on the day of the explosion, 60 % died from flash or flame burns, 30 % from falling debris and 10 % from other causes.
During the following months, large numbers died from the effect of burns, radiation sickness, and अन्य चोटों, compounded by illness.
In a US estimate of the total तात्कालिक और छोटी पद कारण of मौत, 15–20 % died from radiation sickness, 20–30 % from burns, and 50–60 % from other injuries, compounded by illness.
In both cities, most of the dead were नागरिकों, हालांकि हिरोशिमा had a sizeable garrison.
On 15 August, six days after the bombing of Nagasaki, Japan announced its surrender to the Allies, हस्ताक्षर the यंत्र of आत्मसमर्पण on 2 September, officially ending World War II.
The bombings led, in part, to post-war Japan 's adopting तीन non-nuclear सिद्धान्त, forbidding the nation from nuclear armament.
The role of the bombings in जापानी 's आत्मसमर्पण और उनके ethical justification are still debated.
Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi ( ; 2 October 1869 – 30 January 1948 ), commonly known as Mahatma Gandhi, थी the preeminent नेता of भारतीय राष्ट्रवाद in British-ruled India.
employing non-violent सिविल disobedience, गांधी led India to independence and inspired movements for non-violence, civil rights and freedom across the world.
The son of a senior government आधिकारिक, गांधी थी born and raised in a Hindu Bania community in coastal Gujarat, and trained in law in London.
Gandhi became famous by लड़ लिये the सिविल अधिकारों of मुस्लिम और हिन्दू इंडियंस in दक्षिण Africa, using new techniques of non-violent civil disobedience that he developed.
Returning to India in 1915, he set about organising peasants to विरोध excessive land-taxes.
A lifelong opponent of `` communalism `` ( i.e. basing politics on religion ) he reached out widely to all धार्मिक groups.
He became a leader of Muslims protesting the घटती औकात of the Caliphate.
Assuming leadership of the Indian National Congress in 1921, गांधी led देशभर अभियान लिये easing गरीबी, expanding महिलाओं 's rights, building religious and ethnic amity, ending untouchability, increasing economic self-reliance, and above all for achieving Swaraj —the independence of India from British domination.
Gandhi led Indians in protesting the नेशनल नमक कर साथ the dandi नमक March in 1930, and later in demanding the British to immediately Quit India in 1942, during World War II.
He was imprisoned for that and for numerous अन्य राजनैतिक offenses over the years.
Gandhi sought to अभ्यास non-violence and truth in all situations, and advocated that others do the same.
He saw the villages as the core of the true India and promoted self-sufficiency ; he किया नहीं support the industrialization कार्यक्रम of his disciple Jawaharlal Nehru.
He जिया modestly in a self-sufficient आवासीय जातियाँ और wore the traditional Indian dhoti and shawl, woven with yarn he had hand spun on a charkha.
His chief political enemy in ब्रिटेन थी विंस्टन चर्चिल, who ridiculed him as a `` half-naked fakir. ''
He was a dedicated vegetarian, and undertook long fasts as means of both self-purification और राजनैतिक mobilization.
In his last year, unhappy at the partition of India, Gandhi worked to रोकें the carnage between मुसलमान, हिन्दुओं और सिखों कि raged in the border area between India and Pakistan.
he थी assassinated on 30 January 1948 by Nathuram Godse who thought Gandhi was too sympathetic to India 's Muslims.
30 January is observed as शहीदो ' दिन in India.
The honorific Mahatma ( `` Great Soul '' ) was applied to उसे by 1914.
In India he was also called bapu ( `` Father '' ).
He is ज्ञात in इण्डिया as the पिता of the स्वदेश ; उसके जन्मदिवस, 2 अक्तूबर, is commemorated वहीँ as गांधी Jayanti, a national holiday, and world-wide as the International Day of Non-Violence.
Gandhi 's philosophy was not theoretical but one of व्यावहारिकतावाद, कि is, practicing his principles in the moment.
Asked to give a message to the people, he होता respond, `` my जीवन is my message. ''
Joan Crawford ( March 23, ca. 1904 – May 10, 1977 ), born lucille fay lesueur, was an American actress in film, television and theatre.
Starting as a dancer in traveling theatrical companies before debuting on Broadway, Crawford was signed to a motion picture contract by metro-goldwyn-mayer in 1925.
Initially frustrated by the आकार और quality of her parts, Crawford began a campaign of self-publicity and became nationally known as a flapper by the end of the 1920s.
In the 1930s, क्रॉफर्ड 's कीर्ति rivaled, और बाद outlasted, MGM colleagues Norma Shearer and Greta Garbo.
क्रॉफर्ड प्रायः निभाई मेहनती यंग women who find romance and financial success.
These `` rags-to-riches '' stories were खूब प्राप्त by Depression -era audiences and were popular with women.
Crawford became one of Hollywood 's most prominent movie stars and one of the highest paid women in the United States, लकिन उसके films began खोने धन and by the end of the 1930s she was labeled `` box office poison ''.
After an absence of nearly two years from the screen, Crawford staged a comeback by starring in Mildred Pierce ( 1945 ), for which वो जीती the अकादमी पुरस्कार लिये बेहतरीन अभिनेत्री.
In 1955, she became involved with the Pepsi-Cola Company through her विवाह to company Chairman Alfred Steele.
After उसके मौत in 1959, क्रॉफर्ड was elected to fill his vacancy on the board of directors but was forcibly retired in 1973.
She continued acting in film and television regularly through the 1960s, when her performances became fewer ; बाद the रिलीज of the British horror film Trog in 1970, Crawford retired from the screen.
Following a public appearance in 1974, after जिससे unflattering छायाचित्र यहूद प्रकाशित, Crawford withdrew from public life and became increasingly reclusive until her death in 1977.
क्रॉफर्ड शादीशुदा four times.
Her first three marriages ended in divorce ; the last ended with the मौत of husband अल्फ्रेड स्टील.
She adopted five children, one of whom was reclaimed by उसके birth mother.
Crawford 's relationships with her two पुरानी children, क्रिस्टीना and Christopher, were acrimonious.
Crawford disinherited the दो और, बाद क्रॉफर्ड 's मौत, क्रिस्टीना लिखा a `` tell-all '' memoir, Mommie Dearest, in which she alleged a lifelong pattern of physical and emotional abuse perpetrated by Crawford.
She was voted the tenth greatest female star in the history of American सिनेमा by the American Film Institute.

Tonneau cover ( or ) describes a hard or soft cover used to protect unoccupied यात्री सीटे in a convertible or roadster, or the cargo bed in a pickup truck.
Hard tonneau कवर खोलें by a hinging or folding mechanism while soft covers open by rolling up.
The tonneau cover is used to छिपाते कार्गो.
When the cover is pulled out, it keeps items out of the sun and provides extra सुरक्षा by keeping निजी वस्तुएं आउट of sight, as well as shielding the driver from view.
Twitter is an online social networking service and microblogging service that enables its users to send and read text-based संदेश of up to 140 वर्ण, ज्ञात as `` tweets ''.
Twitter was created in March 2006 by Jack Dorsey और by जुलाई, the सोशल नेटवर्किंग साईट थी launched.
The service rapidly gained worldwide popularity, with over 500 million registered users as of 2012, generating over 340 million tweets daily and हैंडलिंग over 1.6 अरब ढूंढें queries per day.
Since its launch, Twitter has become one of the ten most visited websites on the Internet, and has महरूम वर्णित as `` the sms of the Internet. ''
Unregistered users can read tweets, जबकि पंजीकृत उपयोक्ता can post tweets through the website interface, SMS, or a range of apps for mobile devices.
Twitter Inc. is based in सैन फ्रांसिस्को, साथ अतिरिक्त सर्वर और offices in New York City, Boston, and San Antonio.
The Hangover is a 2009 American comedy film, co-produced and directed by टॉड phillips और लिखा by jon लुकास और Scott Moore.
It is the first film of The Hangover franchise.The film stars Bradley कूपर, ed helms, zach galifianakis, हीथर Graham, Justin Bartha, and Jeffrey Tambor.
The Hangover tells the story of Phil Wenneck, Stu Price and Alan Garner, who travel to Las Vegas for a bachelor party to celebrate उनके dost डग billings ' impending marriage.
However, Phil, Stu and Alan have no memory of the previous night 's events and must ढूँढें डग पहले the wedding can take place.
Lucas and Moore wrote the script after executive producer Chris Bender 's friend disappeared and था a विशाल विधेयक बाद होने sent to a strip club.
After Lucas and मूर बेची it to the स्टुडियो लिये $ 2 लाख, फिलिप्स और जेरेमी garelick rewrote the script to include a tiger as well as a subplot involving a baby and a police cruiser, and also including boxer Mike Tyson.
Filming took place in नेवाडा लिये 15 दिनों, और during filming, the three main actors ( Cooper, Helms and Galifianakis ) formed a friendship.
The Hangover was released on June 5, 2009, becoming a critical और वाणिज्यिक कामयाबी.
It became the tenth-highest-grossing फिल्मी of 2009, साथ a विश्वव्यापी gross of over US $ 467 million.
Critics praised the film 's comedic approach लकिन criticized it लिये its vulgarity.
The film won the Golden Globe Award for Best Motion Picture – Musical or कॉमेडी, and received multiple other accolades.
It is the tenth-highest-grossing film of 2009 in the world, as well as the second highest-grossing R-rated comedy ever in the संयुक्त राज्य, surpassing a रिकार्ड previously आयोजित by बेवर्ली पहाड़ियाँ cop लिये लगभग 25 years and later being surpassed by Ted in 2012.
आउट of सब r-rated films, it is the third highest-grossing ever in the U.S., behind only The Passion of the Christ and The Matrix Reloaded.
A sequel, The Hangover Part II, was released in 2011, and a third and final film, The hangover भाग iii, is set for release in 2013.
Events involving meiosis, प्रर्दशित chromosomal crossover
Meiosis ( ) is a special type of कोशिका प्रभाग जरुरी for sexual reproduction in eukaryotes.
The कोशिकाएं उत्पादित by meiosis are gametes or spores.
In many organisms, including all animals and land plants ( but not some other groups such as fungi ), gametes हैं पुकारा शुक्राणु और अंडा कोशिकाएं.
Whilst the process of meiosis bears a number of similarities साथ the 'life-cycle ' कोशिका प्रभाग प्रक्रम of mitosis, it differs in two important respects:
the chromosomes in meiosis undergo a recombination which shuffles the genes producing a अलग जेनेटिक संयोजन in प्रत्येक gamete, compared साथ the co-existence of प्रत्येक of the दो पृथक pairs of each chromosome ( one received from each parent ) in each cell which results from mitosis.
the outcome of meiosis is potentially चार ( genetically अद्वितीय ) अगुणित cells, compared with the two ( genetically identical ) diploid cells produced from mitosis.
Meiosis begins with one diploid cell containing two copies of each chromosome —one इससे the सजीव 's mother and one from its father.
The कोशिका divides twice, potentially producing up to four haploid cells containing one copy of each chromosome.
( `` Potentially '' because in some cases, ऐसे as the formation of oocytes in mammals, only one of the possible four haploid cells survives. )
In animals the haploid cell resulting from meiosis is a पुरूष or female gamete.
प्रत्येक of the resulting गुणसूत्रों in the gamete कोशिकाएं is a अद्वितीय मिश्रण of maternal and paternal DNA, resulting in offspring that are genetically distinct from either parent.
This gives rise to genetic diversity in sexually reproducing populations.
This genetic diversity can provide the variation of physical and behavioural attributes ( phenotypes ) upon which natural selection can act, but, as described below in Section 6, Origin and function of meiosis, the जेनेटिक विविधता may be largely a by-product of the समजात recombination कि is primarily employed लिये इसके डीएनए मरम्मत function during meiosis.
It is also noteworthy कि दौरान meiosis, विशिष्ट जीनों are more highly transcribed, and these are called the meiome, the term used in functional genomics for the meiotic transcriptome.
Meiosis is a key feature for all sexually reproducing eukaryotes in which homologous chromosome pairing, synapse and recombination occur.
In addition to strong meiotic stage-specific expression of mRNA ( the meiome ), however, there are also pervasive translational नियंत्रण ( e.g. चयनात्मक usage of preformed mRNA ), regulating the ultimate meiotic stage-specific protein expression of genes during meiosis.
Thus, both the meiome और translational नियंत्रण determine the broad restructuring of meiotic cells needed to carry out meiosis.
Prior to the meiosis process the कोशिका 's गुणसूत्रों हैं duplicated by a गोलाकार of डीएनए replication, creating from the maternal and paternal versions of each chromosome ( homologs ) two exact copies, sister chromatids, attached at the centromere region.
In the beginning of meiosis the मातृ and paternal homologs pair to each other.
Then they typically exchange parts by homologous recombination leading to crossovers of DNA between the मातृ और पैतृक संस्करण of the chromosome.
Spindle fibers bind to the centromeres of each pair of homologs और arrange the pairs at the spindle equator.
Then the fibers pull the recombined homologs to opposite डंडे of the कोशिका.
As the chromosomes move away from the center the cell divides into दो बेटी कोशिकाएं, प्रत्येक containing a haploid number of chromosomes composed of two chromatids.
After the recombined मातृ और पैतृक homologs have separated into the two daughter cells, a second round of cell division occurs.
There meiosis ends as the दो सिस्टर chromatids बनाना up each homolog are separated and move into one of the four resulting gamete cells.
Upon fertilization, for उदाहरण जब a शुक्राणु enters an egg cell, two gamete cells produced by meiosis fuse.
The gamete from the mother and the gamete इससे the पिता प्रत्येक योगदान एक हाफ of the set of chromosomes that make up the new offspring 's genome.
Meiosis uses many of the same mechanisms as mitosis, a type of cell division used by eukaryotes जैसे पौधे और पशु to split one cell into two identical daughter cells.
In all plants and in many protists meiosis results in the formation of spores : haploid cells that can divide vegetatively बगैर undergoing fertilization.
Boxing ( pugilism, prize fighting, the sweet science or in Greek pygmachia ) is a martial art and combat sport in which two लोगों engage in a प्रतियोगिता of शक्ति, गति, reflexes, endurance and will by throwing punches with gloved hands.
Amateur boxing is an Olympic and Commonwealth sport and is a common fixture in most of the major international games - it also रै इसके अपना संसार championships.
Boxing is पर्यवेक्षित by a रेफरी over a series of one- to three-minute intervals called rounds.
The result is decided when an opponent is deemed incapable to continue by a referee, is disqualified लिये तोड़कर a नियम, resigns by फेंकना in a towel, or is pronounced the winner or loser based on the judges ' scorecards at the end of the contest.
The birth hour of boxing as a sport may be its acceptance by the ancient Greeks as an Olympic game as जल्दी as 688 bc.
Boxing evolved from 16th- and 18th-century prizefights, largely in ग्रेट ब्रिटेन, to the forerunner of modern boxing in the mid-19th century, again initially in Great Britain and later in the United States.
In 2004, ESPN ranked boxing as the most difficult खेल in the world.
Agreement or concord happens when a word changes form depending on the अन्य शब्द to which it relates.
It is an उदाहरण of inflection, और प्रायः involves making the value of some grammatical category ( such as gender or person ) `` agree '' between different words or parts of the sentence.
For example, in Standard English, one may say I am or he is, but not `` i is '' or `` he am ''.
This is because the grammar of the language requires that the verb and इसके विषय सहमत in person.
The pronouns i और he हैं first and third person respectively, as are the verb forms am and is.
The verb form must be selected so that it has the same person as the विषय.
The agreement based on overt grammatical categories as above is formal agreement, in कंट्रास्ट to notional अनुबंध, जिससे is based on meaning.
For instance, the phrase The United States is treated as singular for उद्देश्य of अनुबंध, भी हालांकि it is formally plural.
This is a सूची of places below mean sea level that are on land.
Places in tunnels, mines, basements, dug holes ( also with open sky ), under water, under ice, or existing temporarily as a result of ebbing of sea tide etc. हैं नहीं शामिल.
All figures are in meters नीचे समुद्र level:
Debbie Macomber ( born October 22, 1948 in Yakima, Washington ) is a best-selling अमरीकी लेखक of over 150 romance novels and contemporary women 's fiction.
over 140 million copies of her books are in print throughout the world, and four have become made-for-TV-movies.
macomber थी the inaugural विजेता of the fan-voted Quill Award for romance in 2005 and has been awarded both a Romance Writers of America RITA and a lifetime achievement award by the Romance Writers of America.
Catonsville is a census-designated प्लेस ( cdp ) in Baltimore County, Maryland, United States.
The जनसांख्यिकी थी 41,567 at the 2010 census.
The जातियाँ झूठ to the west of Baltimore along the city 's border.
Catonsville is the home of the University of Maryland, Baltimore काउंटी ( umbc ), a पब्लिक research university with over 12,000 students.
A lawyer, according to Black 's Law शब्दकोष, is `` a person learned in the law ; as an attorney, counsel or solicitor ; a person who is practicing law. ''
Law is the system of नियम of conduct स्थापित by the sovereign सरकारी of a society to correct wrongs, maintain the stability of political and social authority, and deliver justice.
Working as a lawyer involves the practical application of abstract legal theories and knowledge to solve specific individualized problems, or to advance the interests of those जो retain ( i.e., hire ) वकील to perform legal services.
The role of the lawyer varies significantly across legal jurisdictions, और so it can be treated यहाँ in तभी the सबसे general terms.
Vector Marketing is the domestic sales arm of Cutco Corporation, an olean, नई यॉर्क आधारित cutlery manufacturer.
The Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 ( FMLA ) is a संयुक्त राज्य संघीय विधि requiring covered नियोक्ता to provide employees job-protected and unpaid leave for qualified medical and family reasons.
Qualified medical and family reasons include : personal or family illness, परिवार सैन्य छोड़, गर्भावस्था, अपनाना, or the foster care placement of a child.
The FMLA is administered by the मजदूरी और Hour Division of the United States Department of Labor.
the विधेयक थी a major part of President Bill Clinton 's agenda in his first term.
President Clinton signed the bill into law on February 5, 1993 ( ; 29 U.S.C. sec. 2601 ; 29 CFR 825 ) और it took प्रभाव on अगस्त 5, 1993, छह महीने बाद.
The FMLA was intended `` to balance the demands of the workplace with the needs of परिवारों. ''
The Act allows eligible employees to take up to 12 work weeks of unpaid leave during any 12-month period to attend to the serious health condition of the employee, जनक, जीवनसाथी or चाइल्ड, or लिये गर्भावस्था or परवाह of a नवजात चाइल्ड, or लिये अपनाना or foster care of a child.
In order to be eligible for FMLA leave, an employee must have been at the business at least 12 महीने, और worked at तनिक 1,250 घंटों over the पास्ट 12 महीने, and work at a location where the company employs 50 or more employees within 75 miles.
The FMLA covers both public- and private-sector employees, but certain categories of employees are excluded, including elected officials और उनके निजी staff members.
The Vietnam War ( ) was a Cold War -era military conflict that occurred in Vietnam, Laos, and कंबोडिया इससे 1 नवम्बर 1955 to the fall of Saigon on 30 April 1975.
इस युद्ध followed the पहला इंडोचायना युद्ध और was fought between North Vietnam, supported by its communist allies, and the government of South Vietnam, supported by the United States and other anti-communist countries.
The Viet Cong ( also known as the National Liberation Front, or nlf ), a हलके हथियारबंद दक्षिण वियतनामी कम्युनिस्ट आम सामने निर्देशित by the उत्तर, largely fought a guerrilla war against anti-communist forces in the region.
The Vietnam People 's फौज ( उत्तर वियतनामी फौज ) सगाई in a more conventional war, at times committing large units into battle.
U.S. and South Vietnamese forces relied on air बड़प्पन और overwhelming firepower to conduct search and destroy operations, involving ground forces, artillery, and airstrikes.
The U.S. government viewed involvement in the war as a way to prevent a communist takeover of South Vietnam as भाग of उनके wider रणनीति of containment.
The North Vietnamese सरकारी और viet cong यहूद लड़ to reunify Vietnam under communist rule.
They viewed the conflict as a colonial war, fought initially against France, backed by the U.S., और बाद विरूद्ध दक्षिण वियतनाम, which it regarded as a U.S. puppet state.
American military advisors arrived in what was तब फ्रेंच इंडोचायना शुरूआत in 1950.
u.S. भागीदारी escalated in the जल्दी 1960s, with troop levels tripling in 1961 and tripling again in 1962.
U.S. combat units यहूद तैनात beginning in 1965.
Operations spanned international borders, with Laos और कंबोडिया heavily bombed.
American involvement in the war peaked in 1968, at the time of the Tet Offensive.
After this, u.S. मैदान शक्तियां यहूद gradually withdrawn as part of a policy known as Vietnamization.
Despite the पेरिस सलाम accords, हस्ताक्षरित by all parties in January 1973, fighting continued.
U.S. military भागीदारी ended on 15 अगस्त 1973 as a result of the Case–Church Amendment passed by the U.S. Congress.
The कैप्चर of साइगॉन by the वियतनाम लोगों 's फौज in अप्रैल 1975 चिह्नित the end of the war, and North and South Vietnam were reunified the following year.
The war exacted a huge human cost in terms of fatalities ( देखिए वियतनाम युद्ध casualties ).
Estimates of the number of Vietnamese soldiers and civilians मारे vary इससे 800,000 to 3.1 लाख.
Some 200,000–300,000 Cambodians, 20,000–200,000 Laotians, and 58,220 U.S. service members also died in the conflict.
Cleveland Volcano in the Aleutian Islands of Alaska photographed इससे the अंतरराष्ट्रीय स्पेस Station, May 2006.
Ash plumes पहुँचे a ऊँचाई of 19 km during the climactic eruption at Mount Pinatubo, Philippines in 1991.
A volcano is an opening, or rupture, in a planet 's surface or crust, which allows hot magma, volcanic राख और गैसों to एस्केप इससे the मैग्मा कक्ष below the surface.
Volcanoes are generally found where tectonic प्लेटों हैं diverging or converging.
A mid-oceanic ridge, for example the mid-atlantic लकीरें, रै उदाहरण of ज्वालामुखी caused by divergent tectonic plates pulling apart ; the Pacific Ring of Fire has examples of volcanoes caused by convergent tectonic plates coming together.
By contrast, volcanoes are usually not created जहाँ दो tectonic प्लेटों स्लाइड पास्ट one another.
Volcanoes can also form where there is stretching and thinning of the Earth 's crust in the interiors of plates, e.g., in the East African Rift, the कुएं gray-clearwater volcanic फ़ील्ड और the Rio Grande Rift in North America.
This type of volcanism falls अंतर्गत the छतरियाँ of `` Plate hypothesis '' volcanism.
Volcanism away from थाली सीमाएँ रै भी महरूम explained as mantle plumes.
These so-called `` hotspots ``, for example Hawaii, are postulated to arise from upwelling diapirs with magma from the core–mantle boundary, 3,000 km deep in the Earth.
Erupting volcanoes can पोज़ अनेक जोखिमों, नहीं तभी in the तात्कालिक vicinity of the eruption.
Volcanic ash can be a threat to वायुयान, in particular those साथ जेट इंजन where ash particles can be melted by the high operating temperature.
Large eruptions can affect temperature as ash and droplets of sulfuric एसिड अस्पष्ट the सूर्य और कूल the धरती 's निम्नतर माहौल or क्षोभमण्डल ; however, they also absorb heat radiated up from the Earth, thereby warming the stratosphere.
historically, so-called volcanic winters have caused catastrophic famines.
A deep pothole on New York City 's दूसरी एवेन्यू
A pothole ( sometimes called a केतली और ज्ञात in भाग of the पश्चिमी संयुक्त राज्य as a chuckhole ) is a प्रकार of disruption in the surface of a roadway where a portion of the road material has broken away, leaving a hole.
Renal cell कार्सिनोमा ( rcc, भी ज्ञात as hypernephroma ) is a गुर्दा कर्कट that originates in the lining of the proximal convoluted tubule, the very small tubes in the kidney that transport GF ( glomerular filtrate ) from the glomerulus to the descending limb of the nephron.
RCC is the most common type of kidney कर्कट in वयस्कों, जिम्मेदार लिये approximately 80 % of cases.
It is भी ज्ञात to be the सबसे lethal of all the genitourinary tumors.
Initial treatment is most commonly a radical or partial nephrectomy और remains the mainstay of curative treatment.
Where the tumor is confined to the renal parenchyma, the 5-year survival rate is 60-70 %, लकिन इस is lowered considerably जहाँ metastases have स्प्रेड.
It is relatively resistant to विकिरण चिकित्सा और कीमोथेरेपी, although some cases respond to immunotherapy.
targeted कर्कट therapies such as sunitinib, temsirolimus, bevacizumab, interferon-alpha, and sorafenib have improved the outlook for RCC.
Estée Lauder Companies, Inc. is a निर्माता और marketer of प्रतिष्ठा skincare, makeup, fragrance and hair care products.
the कम्पनी has its headquarters in Midtown Manhattan, New York City.
The peritoneum ( ) is the serous membrane that forms the lining of the abdominal cavity or the coelom —it covers most of the intra-abdominal ( or coelomic ) organs—in amniotes और कुछ invertebrates ( annelids, for instance ).
It is composed of a layer of mesothelium supported by a thin layer of connective tissue.
The peritoneum both supports the abdominal organs and serves as a conduit for their रक्त और लसीका बरतन और nerves.
The abdominal cavity ( the space bounded by the vertebrae, abdominal muscles, diaphragm and pelvic floor ) should not be confused with the intraperitoneal स्पेस ( स्तिथ within the abdominal cavity, but wrapped in peritoneum ).
The structures within the intraperitoneal space are called `` intraperitoneal '' ( e.g. the stomach ), the structures in the abdominal cavity that are located behind the intraperitoneal space are called `` retroperitoneal `` ( e.g. the kidneys ), and those structures नीचे the intraperitoneal स्पेस हैं पुकारा `` subperitoneal '' or `` infraperitoneal '' ( e.g. the bladder ).
Modern 2.5 '' SSD used in उपभोक्ता लैपटॉप और desktop computers.
DDR SDRAM आधारित SSD.
Max और.
PCI attached IO त्वरक SSD
PCI-E, dram, और NAND based SSD.
it उपयोग an बाह्य power supply to make the DRAM non-volatile.
A solid-state drive ( SSD ) ( also known as a solid-state डिस्क or इलेक्ट्रॉनिक disk, though it contains no actual `` disk '' of any kind ) is a data storage device using integrated circuit assemblies as memory to store data persistently.
SSD technology uses इलेक्ट्रॉनिक अंतरफलक compatible with traditional block input/output ( I/O ) hard disk drives.
SSDs have no moving mechanical components, which distinguish them from traditional electromechanical magnetic disks such as hard डिस्क ड्राइव ( hdds ) or floppy disks, which contain spinning disks and movable read/write heads.
Compared with electromechanical disks, SSDs are typically less susceptible to physical shock, much quieter, have निम्नतर अभिगम समय, और less latency.
However, while the price of SSDs has जारी to मनाही in 2012, ssds हैं still about 7 to 8 times more expensive per unit of storage than HDDs.
अनेक ssds use I/O interfaces developed for hard disk drives, thus permitting simple replacement in common applications.
, most SSDs use nand-based flash memory, which retains data without power.
For applications requiring fast access, but not necessarily data हठ बाद शक्ति घाटा, ssds may be constructed from random-access memory ( RAM ).
Such devices may employ separate शक्ति स्त्रोत, ऐसे as बैटरी, to maintain data after power loss.
Hybrid drives or solid state hybrid drives ( sshd ) combine the सुविधाएँ of ssds और hdds in the वही ईकाई, containing a large hard disk drive and an SSD cache to improve performance of frequently accessed data.
These devices may offer near-ssd प्रदर्शन लिये many applications.
